citations.narrative:
Three dogs were observed to be have missing ID tags; the licensee said the collar adjustment rings have been breaking.
Also, seven new dogs to the kennel (acquired about 2 months ago) do not have official tags and tag numbers assigned to
them. Proper dog identification is required and can be important in animal health tracking. Ensure that each dog is
properly identified with the required tag on a collar that is safe and made of material generally considered acceptable to
pet owners as a means of identifying their pet dogs.
***Correct by 9/15/2024.

Some of the disposition forms (APHIS 7006) had a transporter noted, however lacked the name and address of the buyer
or receiver. The name and address of the buyer/receiver must be correctly recorded on the disposition form and can be
important for animal health tracing. Ensure that APHIS 7006 has the buyer/reciever recorded on it correctly.
***To be corrected from 8/8/2024 forward.

Three cavapoo puppies were sold and picked up for transport on 3-19-2024 by a broker that were born on 1-29-2024.
These puppies would not have been 8 weeks old until 3/26/2024. Allowing puppies younger than 8 weeks old to be
transported in commerce isn't permitted and can cause health problems in puppies. Ensure that all puppies are 8 weeks
of age and weaned prior to permitting them to be transported in commerce.
***To be corrected from 8/8/2024 forward.

Six weaned puppies are housed in a sheltered enclosure that was made in part of the walkway. There is a kennel stored
between a door of bare wood and the fence is made of bare wood. The stored objects that puppies can access and bare
wood make this area difficult to clean and sanitize. Ensure that if dogs or puppies are to be housed in this area that it can
be readily cleaned and sanitized and doesn't have stored objects within the enclosure.
***Correct by 8/12/2024.

The facility is following an appropriate written program of veterinary care (PVC) that the licensee said was reviewed by the
current attending veterinarian (AV); however the PVC in use wasn't developed and signed by the current AV. To ensure
that the current husbandry and preventive practices are in place, a PVC must be developed and signed by the current
attending veterinarian. Work with the current attending veterinarian to ensure that the written PVC that is being followed is
approved and signed by the AV.
***Correct by September 2, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Three dogs were observed to be have missing ID tags; the licensee said the collar adjustment rings have been breaking. 
Also, seven new dogs to the kennel (acquired about 2 months ago) do not have official tags and tag numbers assigned to 
them. Proper dog identification is required and can be important in animal health tracking. Ensure that each dog is 
properly identified with the required tag on a collar that is safe and made of material generally considered acceptable to 
pet owners as a means of identifying their pet dogs. 
***Correct by 9/15/2024. 
2.75(a)(1)(iv) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Some of the disposition forms (APHIS 7006) had a transporter noted, however lacked the name and address of the buyer 
or receiver. The name and address of the buyer/receiver must be correctly recorded on the disposition form and can be 
important for animal health tracing. Ensure that APHIS 7006 has the buyer/reciever recorded on it correctly.  
***To be corrected from 8/8/2024 forward. 
2.130 
   
Minimum age requirements. 
Three cavapoo puppies were sold and picked up for transport on 3-19-2024 by a broker that were born on 1-29-2024. 
These puppies would not have been 8 weeks old until 3/26/2024. Allowing puppies younger than 8 weeks old to be 
transported in commerce isn't permitted and can cause health problems in puppies. Ensure that all puppies are 8 weeks 
of age and weaned prior to permitting them to be transported in commerce.  
***To be corrected from 8/8/2024 forward. 
3.6(a)(2)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Six weaned puppies are housed in a sheltered enclosure that was made in part of the walkway. There is a kennel stored 
between a door of bare wood and the fence is made of bare wood. The stored objects that puppies can access and bare 
wood make this area difficult to clean and sanitize. Ensure that if dogs or puppies are to be housed in this area that it can

be readily cleaned and sanitized and doesn't have stored objects within the enclosure.  
***Correct by 8/12/2024. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is following an appropriate written program of veterinary care (PVC) that the licensee said was reviewed by the 
current attending veterinarian (AV); however the PVC in use wasn't developed and signed by the current AV. To ensure 
that the current husbandry and preventive practices are in place, a PVC must be developed and signed by the current 
attending veterinarian. Work with the current attending veterinarian to ensure that the written PVC that is being followed is 
approved and signed by the AV. 
***Correct by September 2, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
